results.name: Double and reverse digits.
link: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Nick Hobson, Python program for this sequence
formula: Conjecture: a(n)^(1/n) tends to sqrt(10). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 03 2020
mathematica: NestList[IntegerReverse[2#]&,1,30] (* Requires Mathematica version 10 or later *) (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jun 18 2017 *)
xref: The following are parallel families: A000079 (2^n), A004094 (2^n reversed), A028909 (2^n sorted up), A028910 (2^n sorted down), A036447 (double and reverse), A057615 (double and sort up), A263451 (double and sort down); A000244 (3^n), A004167 (3^n reversed), A321540 (3^n sorted up), A321539 (3^n sorted down), A163632 (triple and reverse), A321542 (triple and sort up), A321541 (triple and sort down).
results.author: _Rodolfo Kurchan_
ext: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Mar 31 2000
